metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5730 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to add principals to an LDAP Kerberos database to circumvent a DN containership check by supplying both a "linkdn" and "containerdn" database argument, or by supplying a DN string which is a left extension of a container DN string but is not hierarchically within the container DN. It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled certain database arguments. A remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5730` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
krb5-gss-samples - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
krb5-k5tls - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
krb5-kdc - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
krb5-locales - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
krb5-multidev - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
krb5-otp - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
krb5-pkinit - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
krb5-user - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
libgssrpc4 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
libk5crypto3 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
libkadm5clnt-mit9 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
libkadm5srv-mit9 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
libkdb5-8 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
libkrad0 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
libkrb5-3 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
libkrb5support0 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: krb5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.2+dfsg-5ubuntu2.1').
